TextBlock.Text: BETULA: I hope you all don't mind, but I sent Oryza the requirement that we would have a dried-out seabed on one of our planets. To help with this, I placed an ocean on one of the planets (which I have now named WATER_PLANET_NAME) so that it will have time to form a proper seabed.
ALNUS: Is our star hot enough to boil the water off of the planet once the seabed forms?
BETULA: ...It appears that it may not be. My apologies, I hope that I did not just give us an impossible requirement.
ADONSONIA: If we can't boil the water off, perhaps there's some way for us to move it somewhere else...
ADONSONIA: An interesting idea! Dried seabeds are fairly common in real star systems, so that should work well for this project.
DAUCUS: A requirement that fulfills itself with time, good idea.
